DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate effectiveness program strengthen relationship disadvantage expectant couple , increase co-parenting , father involvement , economic stability . Couples randomly assign Family Expectations control group , assess baseline one year .
DOC.brief_title: Impact Evaluation Family Expectations : A Program Strengthen Relationships Disadvantaged Expectant Couples
DOC.detailed_description: The birth child trigger relationship distress dissolution . Family Expectations ( FE ) target transition parenthood critical time help couple focus family success . Regardless whether couple marry unmarried , goal FE strengthen relationship advance well-being economically disadvantage couple expect baby new parent , improve live child . The FE program , include Becoming Parents ( BP ) curriculum supplemental service , design address specific risk factor affect individual family member relationships among , build protective factor help family avoid , minimize , manage risk ( e.g. , individual maladaptation [ mother , father , child ] , couple relationship difficulty , parent difficulty , economic insufficiency ) . A total 1,355 couple randomly assign either Family Expectations ( n = 813 ; 60 % ) untreated control group ( n = 542 ; 40 % ) . Once assign , participant study complete baseline question survey . Those assigned FE track schedule service FE intervention team control group receive FE intervention . Members intervention control group survey randomly assign 12 month later . The study examine Family Expectations program associate improved outcome relationship quality , stability , parent quality , father involvement , child wellbeing , hopefulness employment .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Both partner willing participate 2 . Partners commitment together couple 3 . Both partner biological parent child current pregnancy child bear within past 3 month 4 . Fluent English ( study intervention material English ) 1 . Either partner take part Family Expectations service
